intro: Flaveria pubescens, commonly known as the hairy ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies and roadsides, and it thrives in full sun. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Flaveria pubescens is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insects.
